page.title: 10R.M.MUSEUM,PORTSMOUTH
page.content: The Royal Marines' Barracks was built in 1864 and used to house the Royal Marines Artillery. At one time there were over 1000men. Streets near the barracks have names linked with the Marines such as Lumsden Road and Halliday Crescent which are named after Marines awarded the V.C. Now the barracks is nearly empty, apart from the {Royal Marines Museum and 200 Marines including the 100 bandsmen that provide the band for the Royal Yacht. There is also a cadet corps. The award winning {Royal Marines' {Museum} has a large collection of medals, uniforms, personal letters and belongings of such famous people as Nelson.The barracks,apart from the museum are to be sold but as some of the buildings are heavily listed they cannot be pulled down.
